sentences: Aitasin vanakest trepist 체les minnes kaenla alt.
context: The Estonian verb 'aitama' primarily means to assist or help someone in various contexts - physically, emotionally, economically, or intellectually. It can also mean that something is sufficient or enough when used impersonally. The word changes form based on conjugation (e.g., aitan - I help, aitab - he/she/it helps).
